regulation.title: Safety and Health Regulations for Construction - Scaffolds
regulation.applies_to: all scaffolds used in workplaces covered under 29 CFR part 1926
excludes: crane or derrick suspended personnel platforms

sections.title: Scope, application and definitions applicable to this subpart

rules.text: This subpart applies to all scaffolds used in workplaces covered by this part. It does not apply to crane or derrick suspended personnel platforms.
rules.requirement: apply scaffold regulations to all scaffolds except crane/derrick platforms

items.description: crane or derrick suspended personnel platforms

rules.text: Open sides and ends means the edges of a platform that are more than 14 inches (36 cm) away horizontally from a sturdy, continuous, vertical surface or a sturdy, continuous horizontal surface, or a point of access. Exception: For plastering and lathing operations the horizontal threshold distance is 18 inches (46 cm).
rules.requirement: classify platform edges as open when more than 14 inches from sturdy surface (18 inches for plastering/lathing)

conditions.condition: platform edge distance from sturdy surface

items.description: plastering and lathing operations threshold is 18 inches

rules.text: Each scaffold and scaffold component shall be capable of supporting, without failure, its own weight and at least 4 times the maximum intended load applied or transmitted to it.
rules.requirement: design scaffolds to support own weight plus 4 times maximum intended load

items.description: as provided in paragraphs (a)(2), (a)(3), (a)(4), (a)(5) and (g)

rules.text: Direct connections to roofs and floors, and counterweights used to balance adjustable suspension scaffolds, shall be capable of resisting at least 4 times the tipping moment imposed by the scaffold operating at the rated load of the hoist, or 1.5 (minimum) times the tipping moment imposed by the scaffold operating at the stall load of the hoist, whichever is greater.
rules.requirement: design roof/floor connections and counterweights to resist 4x rated load or 1.5x stall load tipping moment

conditions.condition: tipping moment resistance at rated load
tipping moment resistance at stall load

rules.text: Each suspension rope, including connecting hardware, used on non-adjustable suspension scaffolds shall be capable of supporting, without failure, at least 6 times the maximum intended load applied or transmitted to that rope.
rules.requirement: design non-adjustable suspension ropes to support 6 times maximum intended load

rules.text: Each suspension rope, including connecting hardware, used on adjustable suspension scaffolds shall be capable of supporting, without failure, at least 6 times the maximum intended load applied or transmitted to that rope with the scaffold operating at either the rated load of the hoist, or 2 (minimum) times the stall load of the hoist, whichever is greater.
rules.requirement: design adjustable suspension ropes to support 6x load at rated capacity or 2x stall load

conditions.condition: adjustable suspension rope at rated load
adjustable suspension rope at stall load

protections: adequate rope strength under all conditions

rules.text: The stall load of any scaffold hoist shall not exceed 3 times its rated load.
rules.requirement: limit scaffold hoist stall load to maximum 3 times rated load

rules.text: Each platform unit shall be installed so that the space between adjacent units and the space between the platform and the uprights is no more than 1 inch (2.5 cm) wide, except where the employer can demonstrate that a wider space is necessary.
rules.requirement: limit platform gaps to maximum 1 inch between units and uprights

conditions.condition: gap between platform units or uprights

items.description: where employer can demonstrate wider space is necessary

rules.text: Where the employer makes the demonstration provided for in paragraph (b)(1)(i), the platform shall be planked or decked as fully as possible and the remaining open space between the platform and the uprights shall not exceed 9½ inches (24.1 cm).
rules.requirement: limit maximum platform gap to 9.5 inches when wider space demonstrated necessary
rules.applies_to: scaffold platforms with demonstrated wider spacing needs

conditions.condition: maximum platform gap when wider space needed

rules.text: Each scaffold platform and walkway shall be at least 18 inches (46 cm) wide.
rules.requirement: maintain minimum platform and walkway width of 18 inches

items.description: as provided in paragraphs (b)(2)(i) and (b)(2)(ii)

rules.text: Each ladder jack scaffold, top plate bracket scaffold, roof bracket scaffold, and pump jack scaffold shall be at least 12 inches (30 cm) wide. There is no minimum width requirement for boatswains' chairs.
rules.requirement: maintain minimum 12-inch width for specific scaffold types, no width requirement for boatswains' chairs
rules.applies_to: ladder jack, top plate bracket, roof bracket, and pump jack scaffolds

items.description: boatswains' chairs have no minimum width requirement

rules.text: The front edge of all platforms shall not be more than 14 inches (36 cm) from the face of the work, unless guardrail systems are erected along the front edge and/or personal fall arrest systems are used.
rules.requirement: limit platform distance from work face to 14 inches unless protection provided

items.description: as provided in paragraph (b)(3)(i) for outrigger scaffolds
as provided in paragraph (b)(3)(ii) for plastering and lathing

rules.text: The maximum distance from the face for outrigger scaffolds shall be 3 inches (8 cm).
rules.requirement: limit outrigger scaffold distance from work face to 3 inches

conditions.condition: outrigger scaffold distance from work face

rules.text: The maximum distance from the face for plastering and lathing operations shall be 18 inches (46 cm).
rules.requirement: limit platform distance from work face to 18 inches for plastering and lathing
rules.applies_to: platforms used for plastering and lathing

conditions.condition: platform distance from work face for plastering/lathing

rules.text: Each end of a platform, unless cleated or otherwise restrained by hooks or equivalent means, shall extend over the centerline of its support at least 6 inches (15 cm).
rules.requirement: ensure platform extends minimum 6 inches over support centerline unless restrained

items.description: platforms cleated or restrained by hooks or equivalent

rules.text: Each end of a platform 10 feet or less in length shall not extend over its support more than 12 inches (30 cm) unless the platform is designed and installed so that the cantilevered portion can support employees and/or materials without tipping, or has guardrails which block employee access to the cantilevered end.
rules.requirement: limit platform overhang to 12 inches for platforms 10 feet or less unless properly designed
rules.applies_to: platforms 10 feet or less in length

items.description: platform designed to support cantilever without tipping
guardrails block employee access to cantilevered end

rules.text: Each platform greater than 10 feet in length shall not extend over its support more than 18 inches (46 cm), unless it is designed and installed so that the cantilevered portion of the platform is able to support employees without tipping, or has guardrails which block employee access to the cantilevered end.
rules.requirement: limit platform overhang to 18 inches for platforms greater than 10 feet unless properly designed
rules.applies_to: platforms greater than 10 feet in length

items.description: platform designed to support cantilever without tipping
guardrails block employee access to cantilevered end

rules.text: On scaffolds where platforms are overlapped to create a long platform, the overlap shall occur only over supports, and shall not be less than 12 inches (30 cm) unless the platforms are nailed together or otherwise restrained to prevent movement.
rules.requirement: ensure platform overlaps are minimum 12 inches over supports unless restrained

items.description: platforms nailed together or otherwise restrained

rules.text: Platforms shall not deflect more than 1/60 of the span when loaded.
rules.requirement: limit platform deflection to maximum 1/60 of span under load

rules.text: Supported scaffolds with a height to base width (including outrigger supports, if used) ratio of more than four to one (4:1) shall be restrained from tipping by guying, tying, bracing, or equivalent means.
rules.requirement: restrain scaffolds with height to base ratio greater than 4:1 from tipping

rules.text: Guys, ties, and braces shall be installed according to the scaffold manufacturer's recommendations or at the closest horizontal member to the 4:1 height and be repeated vertically at locations of horizontal members every 20 feet (6.1 m) or less thereafter for scaffolds 3 feet (0.91 m) wide or less, and every 26 feet (7.9 m) or less thereafter for scaffolds greater than 3 feet (0.91 m) wide.
rules.requirement: install restraints at 4:1 height then every 20 feet for narrow scaffolds or every 26 feet for wide scaffolds

conditions.condition: restraint vertical spacing for narrow scaffolds
restraint vertical spacing for wide scaffolds

rules.text: Such guys, ties and braces shall be installed at each end of the scaffold and at horizontal intervals not to exceed 30 feet (9.1 m) (measured from one end [not both] towards the other).
rules.requirement: install restraints at scaffold ends and at maximum 30-foot horizontal intervals

rules.text: When scaffold platforms are more than 2 feet (0.6 m) above or below a point of access, portable ladders, hook-on ladders, attachable ladders, stair towers, stairway-type ladders, ramps, walkways, integral prefabricated scaffold access, or direct access from another scaffold, structure, personnel hoist, or similar surface shall be used.
rules.requirement: provide proper access when platforms are more than 2 feet from access point

items.description: crossbraces shall not be used as access

rules.text: Hook-on and attachable ladders shall be positioned so that their bottom rung is not more than 24 inches (61 cm) above the scaffold supporting level.
rules.requirement: position hook-on and attachable ladders with bottom rung maximum 24 inches above supporting level

conditions.condition: bottom rung height above supporting level

rules.text: When hook-on and attachable ladders are used on a supported scaffold more than 35 feet (10.7 m) high, they shall have rest platforms at 35-foot (10.7 m) maximum vertical intervals.
rules.requirement: provide rest platforms every 35 feet maximum for ladders on scaffolds over 35 feet high
rules.applies_to: hook-on and attachable ladders on high scaffolds

rules.text: Hook-on and attachable ladders shall have a minimum rung length of 11½ inches (29 cm).
rules.requirement: ensure hook-on and attachable ladders have minimum 11.5-inch rung length

rules.text: Hook-on and attachable ladders shall have uniformly spaced rungs with a maximum spacing between rungs of 16¾ inches.
rules.requirement: maintain maximum 16.75-inch spacing between ladder rungs

rules.text: Stairway-type ladders shall be positioned such that their bottom step is not more than 24 inches (61 cm) above the scaffold supporting level.
rules.requirement: position stairway-type ladders with bottom step maximum 24 inches above supporting level

conditions.condition: bottom step height above supporting level

rules.text: Stairway-type ladders shall be provided with rest platforms at 12 foot (3.7 m) maximum vertical intervals.
rules.requirement: provide rest platforms every 12 feet maximum for stairway-type ladders

rules.text: Stairway-type ladders shall have a minimum step width of 16 inches (41 cm), except that mobile scaffold stairway-type ladders shall have a minimum step width of 11½ inches (30 cm).
rules.requirement: maintain minimum step width of 16 inches (11.5 inches for mobile scaffolds)

items.description: mobile scaffold stairway-type ladders minimum 11.5 inches

rules.text: Stairtowers shall be positioned such that their bottom step is not more than 24 inches (61 cm.) above the scaffold supporting level.
rules.requirement: position stairtowers with bottom step maximum 24 inches above supporting level

conditions.condition: stairtower bottom step height above supporting level

rules.text: Handrails, and toprails that are used as handrails, shall be at least 3 inches (7.6 cm) from other objects.
rules.requirement: maintain minimum 3-inch clearance between handrails and other objects
rules.applies_to: handrails and toprails used as handrails

rules.text: Stairrails shall be not less than 28 inches (71 cm) nor more than 37 inches (94 cm) from the upper surface of the stairrail to the surface of the tread, in line with the face of the riser at the forward edge of the tread.
rules.requirement: maintain stairrail height between 28-37 inches from tread surface

rules.text: A landing platform at least 18 inches (45.7 cm) wide by at least 18 inches (45.7 cm) long shall be provided at each level.
rules.requirement: provide landing platforms minimum 18x18 inches at each level

rules.text: Each scaffold stairway shall be at least 18 inches (45.7 cm) wide between stairrails.
rules.requirement: maintain minimum 18-inch width between stairrails

rules.text: Stairways shall be installed between 40 degrees and 60 degrees from the horizontal.
rules.requirement: install stairways at angles between 40-60 degrees from horizontal

rules.text: Riser height shall be uniform, within ¼ inch, (0.6 cm) for each flight of stairs. Greater variations in riser height are allowed for the top and bottom steps of the entire system, not for each flight of stairs.
rules.requirement: maintain uniform riser height within 0.25 inch per flight

items.description: greater variations allowed for top and bottom steps of entire system

rules.text: Tread depth shall be uniform, within ¼ inch, for each flight of stairs.
rules.requirement: maintain uniform tread depth within 0.25 inch per flight

rules.text: No ramp or walkway shall be inclined more than a slope of one (1) vertical to three (3) horizontal (20 degrees above the horizontal).
rules.requirement: limit ramp and walkway slope to maximum 1:3 (20 degrees)

rules.text: If the slope of a ramp or a walkway is steeper than one (1) vertical in eight (8) horizontal, the ramp or walkway shall have cleats not more than fourteen (14) inches (35 cm) apart which are securely fastened to the planks to provide footing.
rules.requirement: install cleats maximum 14 inches apart when slope exceeds 1:8

rules.text: Integral prefabricated scaffold access frames shall have a rung length of at least 8 inches (20 cm).
rules.requirement: ensure integral access frame rungs minimum 8 inches long

rules.text: Integral prefabricated scaffold access frames shall not be used as work platforms when rungs are less than 11½ inches in length, unless each affected employee uses fall protection, or a positioning device, which complies with § 1926.502.
rules.requirement: prohibit use as work platforms when rungs less than 11.5 inches unless fall protection used

items.description: each affected employee uses fall protection or positioning device per § 1926.502

rules.text: Integral prefabricated scaffold access frames shall be provided with rest platforms at 35-foot (10.7 m) maximum vertical intervals on all supported scaffolds more than 35 feet (10.7 m) high.
rules.requirement: provide rest platforms every 35 feet maximum on scaffolds over 35 feet high
rules.applies_to: integral access frames on high scaffolds

rules.text: Integral prefabricated scaffold access frames shall have a maximum spacing between rungs of 16¾ inches (43 cm). Non-uniform rung spacing caused by joining end frames together is allowed, provided the resulting spacing does not exceed 16¾ inches (43 cm).
rules.requirement: maintain maximum 16.75-inch spacing between access frame rungs

items.description: non-uniform spacing from joining frames allowed if not exceeding 16.75 inches

rules.text: Direct access to or from another surface shall be used only when the scaffold is not more than 14 inches (36 cm) horizontally and not more than 24 inches (61 cm) vertically from the other surface.
rules.requirement: allow direct access only when within 14 inches horizontally and 24 inches vertically

rules.text: When erecting or dismantling tubular welded frame scaffolds, (end) frames, with horizontal members that are parallel, level and are not more than 22 inches apart vertically may be used as climbing devices for access, provided they are erected in a manner that creates a usable ladder and provides good hand hold and foot space.
rules.requirement: allow frame climbing when horizontal members are maximum 22 inches apart vertically
rules.applies_to: tubular welded frame scaffolds during erection/dismantling

conditions.condition: vertical spacing of horizontal frame members

rules.text: The clearance between scaffolds and power lines shall be maintained according to specified distances based on voltage levels.
rules.requirement: maintain specified clearances from power lines based on voltage

conditions.unit: feet plus 0.4 inches per kV over 50
feet plus 0.4 inches per kV over 50

triggers.expression: insulated_under_300v OR insulated_300v_50kv OR insulated_over_50kv OR uninsulated_under_50kv OR uninsulated_over_50kv

items.description: when utility company deenergizes, relocates, or installs protective coverings

rules.text: Each employee on a scaffold more than 10 feet (3.1 m) above a lower level shall be protected from falling to that lower level.
rules.requirement: provide fall protection for employees on scaffolds more than 10 feet above lower level

rules.text: The top edge height of toprails or equivalent member on supported scaffolds manufactured or placed in service after January 1, 2000 shall be installed between 38 inches (0.97 m) and 45 inches (1.2 m) above the platform surface.
rules.requirement: install toprails between 38-45 inches high on supported scaffolds manufactured after 2000

conditions.condition: toprail height minimum for new scaffolds
toprail height maximum for new scaffolds

items.description: height may exceed 45 inches when conditions warrant

rules.text: The top edge height on supported scaffolds manufactured and placed in service before January 1, 2000, and on all suspended scaffolds where both a guardrail and a personal fall arrest system are required shall be between 36 inches (0.9 m) and 45 inches (1.2 m).
rules.requirement: install toprails between 36-45 inches high on older scaffolds and suspended scaffolds with dual protection
rules.applies_to: supported scaffolds manufactured before 2000 and suspended scaffolds with dual protection

conditions.condition: toprail height minimum for old scaffolds
toprail height maximum for old scaffolds

items.description: height may exceed 45 inches when conditions warrant

rules.text: When intermediate members (such as balusters or additional rails) are used, they shall not be more than 19 inches (48 cm) apart.
rules.requirement: space intermediate guardrail members maximum 19 inches apart

rules.text: Each toprail or equivalent member of a guardrail system shall be capable of withstanding, without failure, a force applied in any downward or horizontal direction at any point along its top edge of at least 100 pounds (445 n) for guardrail systems installed on single-point adjustable suspension scaffolds or two-point adjustable suspension scaffolds.
rules.requirement: design suspension scaffold guardrails to withstand minimum 100 pound force

rules.text: Each toprail or equivalent member of a guardrail system shall be capable of withstanding, without failure, a force applied in any downward or horizontal direction at any point along its top edge of at least 200 pounds (890 n) for guardrail systems installed on all other scaffolds.
rules.requirement: design other scaffold guardrails to withstand minimum 200 pound force

rules.text: Midrails, screens, mesh, intermediate vertical members, solid panels, and equivalent structural members of a guardrail system shall be capable of withstanding, without failure, a force applied in any downward or horizontal direction at any point along the midrail or other member of at least 75 pounds (333 n) for guardrail systems with a minimum 100 pound toprail capacity.
rules.requirement: design intermediate guardrail components to withstand 75 pound force for 100-lb toprail systems
rules.applies_to: intermediate guardrail components on suspension scaffolds

rules.text: Midrails, screens, mesh, intermediate vertical members, solid panels, and equivalent structural members of a guardrail system shall be capable of withstanding, without failure, a force applied in any downward or horizontal direction at any point along the midrail or other member of at least 150 pounds (666 n) for guardrail systems with a minimum 200 pound toprail capacity.
rules.requirement: design intermediate guardrail components to withstand 150 pound force for 200-lb toprail systems
rules.applies_to: intermediate guardrail components on other scaffolds

rules.text: Crossbracing is acceptable in place of a midrail when the crossing point of two braces is between 20 inches (0.5 m) and 30 inches (0.8 m) above the work platform or as a toprail when the crossing point of two braces is between 38 inches (0.97 m) and 48 inches (1.3 m) above the work platform. The end points at each upright shall be no more than 48 inches (1.3 m) apart.
rules.requirement: allow crossbracing as midrail when crossing point 20-30 inches high or as toprail when 38-48 inches high, with endpoints maximum 48 inches apart

conditions.condition: crossbrace crossing point for midrail minimum
crossbrace crossing point for midrail maximum
crossbrace crossing point for toprail minimum
crossbrace crossing point for toprail maximum

triggers.expression: (crossbrace_midrail_min AND crossbrace_midrail_max) OR (crossbrace_toprail_min AND crossbrace_toprail_max) AND crossbrace_endpoint_spacing

rules.text: A toeboard shall be erected along the edge of platforms more than 10 feet (3.1 m) above lower levels for a distance sufficient to protect employees below, except on float (ship) scaffolds where an edging of ¾ × 1½ inch (2 × 4 cm) wood or equivalent may be used in lieu of toeboards.
rules.requirement: install toeboards on platforms more than 10 feet above lower levels

items.description: float scaffolds may use 3/4 x 1.5 inch edging instead

rules.text: Where used, toeboards shall be capable of withstanding, without failure, a force of at least 50 pounds (222 n) applied in any downward or horizontal direction at any point along the toeboard.
rules.requirement: design toeboards to withstand minimum 50 pound force

rules.text: Toeboards shall be at least three and one-half inches (9 cm) high from the top edge of the toeboard to the level of the walking/working surface. They shall have not more than ¼ inch (0.7 cm) clearance above the walking/working surface.
rules.requirement: maintain toeboard minimum 3.5 inches high with maximum 0.25 inch clearance

sections.title: Additional requirements applicable to specific types of scaffolds

rules.text: Pole scaffolds over 60 feet in height shall be designed by a registered professional engineer, and shall be constructed and loaded in accordance with that design.
rules.requirement: require professional engineer design for pole scaffolds over 60 feet high

rules.text: Tube and coupler scaffolds over 125 feet in height shall be designed by a registered professional engineer, and shall be constructed and loaded in accordance with such design.
rules.requirement: require professional engineer design for tube and coupler scaffolds over 125 feet high

rules.text: Scaffolds over 125 feet (38.0 m) in height above their base plates shall be designed by a registered professional engineer, and shall be constructed and loaded in accordance with such design.
rules.requirement: require professional engineer design for fabricated frame scaffolds over 125 feet high

rules.text: Scaffolds shall not exceed three tiers in height, and shall be so constructed and arranged that one square rests directly above the other.
rules.requirement: limit bricklayers' square scaffolds to maximum 3 tiers in height

rules.text: Scaffolds shall not be constructed or arranged more than two tiers or 10 feet (3.0 m) in height, whichever is less.
rules.requirement: limit horse scaffolds to maximum 2 tiers or 10 feet height, whichever is less

rules.text: The inboard end of outrigger beams, measured from the fulcrum point to the extreme point of anchorage, shall be not less than one and one-half times the outboard end in length.
rules.requirement: ensure inboard end of outrigger beams is minimum 1.5 times outboard length

rules.text: The fulcrum point of outrigger beams shall rest on secure bearings at least 6 inches (15.2 cm) in each horizontal dimension.
rules.requirement: provide outrigger beam bearings minimum 6x6 inches

conditions.condition: bearing size in each horizontal dimension

rules.text: When the pump jack has to pass bracing already installed, an additional brace shall be installed approximately 4 feet (1.2 m) above the brace to be passed, and shall be left in place until the pump jack has been moved and the original brace reinstalled.
rules.requirement: install additional brace 4 feet above existing brace when pump jack must pass through

conditions.condition: additional brace height above existing brace

protections: continuous bracing during pump jack movement

rules.text: Platforms shall not exceed a height of 20 feet (6.1 m).
rules.requirement: limit ladder jack scaffold platforms to maximum 20 feet height

rules.text: The ladder jack shall be so designed and constructed that it will bear on the side rails and ladder rungs or on the ladder rungs alone. If bearing on rungs only, the bearing area shall include a length of at least 10 inches (25.4 cm) on each rung.
rules.requirement: ensure ladder jack bearing area minimum 10 inches per rung when bearing on rungs only
rules.applies_to: ladder jacks bearing on rungs only

rules.text: Boatswains' chair tackle shall consist of correct size ball bearings or bushed blocks containing safety hooks and properly 'eye-spliced' minimum five-eighth (5/8) inch (1.6 cm) diameter first-grade manila rope, or other rope which will satisfy the criteria of manila rope.
rules.requirement: use minimum 5/8-inch diameter first-grade manila rope or equivalent for boatswains' chair tackle

rules.text: Boatswains' chair seat slings shall be a minimum of five-eight (5/8) inch (1.6 cm) diameter fiber, synthetic, or other rope which will satisfy the criteria of first grade manila rope.
rules.requirement: use minimum 5/8-inch diameter rope for boatswains' chair seat slings

rules.text: When a heat-producing process such as gas or arc welding is being conducted, boatswains' chair seat slings shall be a minimum of three-eight (3/8) inch (1.0 cm) wire rope.
rules.requirement: use minimum 3/8-inch wire rope for boatswains' chair seat slings during welding
rules.applies_to: boatswains' chair seat slings during welding

rules.text: Platforms shall not be more than 36 inches (0.9 m) wide unless designed by a qualified person to prevent unstable conditions.
rules.requirement: limit two-point suspension scaffold platforms to 36 inches wide unless designed by qualified person

items.description: wider platforms designed by qualified person

rules.text: Manual force used to move the scaffold shall be applied as close to the base as practicable, but not more than 5 feet (1.5 m) above the supporting surface.
rules.requirement: apply manual moving force maximum 5 feet above supporting surface

conditions.condition: height of force application above surface

rules.text: Employees shall not be allowed to ride on scaffolds unless the surface on which the scaffold is being moved is within 3 degrees of level, and free of pits, holes, and obstructions.
rules.requirement: ensure moving surface within 3 degrees of level and free of hazards when employees ride scaffolds

rules.text: The height to base width ratio of the scaffold during movement is two to one or less, unless the scaffold is designed and constructed to meet or exceed nationally recognized stability test requirements.
rules.requirement: maintain height to base ratio of 2:1 or less during movement unless meeting stability tests

conditions.condition: height to base width ratio during movement

items.description: scaffold meets nationally recognized stability test requirements

rules.text: When power systems are used, the propelling force is applied directly to the wheels, and does not produce a speed in excess of 1 foot per second (.3 mps).
rules.requirement: limit powered mobile scaffold speed to maximum 1 foot per second

rules.text: Brackets shall be secured in place by at least one wire rope at least ½ inch (1.27 cm) in diameter.
rules.requirement: secure repair brackets with minimum 0.5-inch diameter wire rope

rules.text: When a wire rope is placed around the structure in order to provide a safe anchorage for personal fall arrest systems used by employees erecting or dismantling scaffolds, the wire rope shall meet the requirements of subpart M of this part, but shall be at least 5/16 inch (0.8 cm) in diameter.
rules.requirement: use minimum 5/16-inch diameter wire rope for fall arrest anchorages
rules.applies_to: wire rope anchorages for fall arrest

rules.text: An employee may wear stilts on a scaffold only if it is a large area scaffold.
rules.requirement: allow stilts only on large area scaffolds
work_types: large area scaffold work with stilts

rules.text: When an employee is using stilts on a large area scaffold where a guardrail system is used to provide fall protection, the guardrail system shall be increased in height by an amount equal to the height of the stilts being used by the employee.
rules.requirement: increase guardrail height by stilt height when stilts are used
rules.applies_to: guardrail systems when stilts are used

rules.text: Aerial lifts acquired for use on or after January 22, 1973 shall be designed and constructed in conformance with ANSI A92.2-1969. Aerial lifts acquired before January 22, 1973 which do not meet the requirements may not be used after January 1, 1976, unless modified to conform.
rules.requirement: ensure aerial lifts meet ANSI A92.2-1969 based on acquisition and use dates

conditions.condition: non-compliant lifts acquired before 1973 used after January 1, 1976

items.description: field modifications certified by manufacturer or equivalent entity

rules.text: A body belt shall be worn and a lanyard attached to the boom or basket when working from an aerial lift.
rules.requirement: wear body belt with lanyard attached to boom or basket when working from aerial lift

rules.text: Boom and basket load limits specified by the manufacturer shall not be exceeded.
rules.requirement: do not exceed manufacturer-specified boom and basket load limits

rules.text: The brakes shall be set and when outriggers are used, they shall be positioned on pads or a solid surface. Wheel chocks shall be installed before using an aerial lift on an incline, provided they can be safely installed.
rules.requirement: set brakes, position outriggers on solid surface, and use wheel chocks on inclines

items.description: wheel chocks only if they can be safely installed

rules.text: An aerial lift truck shall not be moved when the boom is elevated in a working position with men in the basket, except for equipment which is specifically designed for this type of operation.
rules.requirement: do not move aerial lift truck with elevated boom and occupied basket unless specifically designed for movement

items.description: equipment specifically designed for movement with elevated boom

rules.text: All electrical tests shall conform to the requirements of ANSI A92.2-1969 section 5. However equivalent d.c. voltage tests may be used in lieu of the a.c. voltage specified, provided they are approved by the equipment manufacturer or equivalent entity.
rules.requirement: conduct electrical tests per ANSI A92.2-1969 section 5 or equivalent approved d.c. tests

items.description: equivalent d.c. voltage tests approved by manufacturer

rules.text: The provisions of ANSI A92.2-1969, section 4.9 Bursting Safety Factor shall apply to all critical hydraulic and pneumatic components. Critical components are those in which a failure would result in a free fall or free rotation of the boom. All noncritical components shall have a bursting safety factor of at least 2 to 1.
rules.requirement: apply ANSI bursting safety factors to critical components and minimum 2:1 safety factor to noncritical components
rules.applies_to: aerial lift hydraulic and pneumatic components

rules.text: The employer shall have each employee who performs work while on a scaffold trained by a person qualified in the subject matter to recognize the hazards associated with the type of scaffold being used and to understand the procedures to control or minimize those hazards.
rules.requirement: provide scaffold hazard recognition training by qualified person for all employees working on scaffolds

rules.text: The employer shall have each employee who is involved in erecting, disassembling, moving, operating, repairing, maintaining, or inspecting a scaffold trained by a competent person to recognize any hazards associated with the work in question.
rules.requirement: provide specialized scaffold training by competent person for employees involved in scaffold operations

rules.text: When the employer has reason to believe that an affected employee lacks the skill or understanding needed for safe work involving scaffolds, the employer shall retrain each such employee. Retraining is required where changes at the worksite present a hazard about which an employee has not been previously trained.
rules.requirement: provide retraining when employee lacks understanding or when worksite changes present new hazards
rules.applies_to: employees with inadequate scaffold knowledge or facing new hazards

conditions.condition: employee lacks required skill or understanding

rules.text: Retraining is required where changes in the types of scaffolds, fall protection, falling object protection, or other equipment present a hazard about which an employee has not been previously trained.
rules.requirement: provide retraining when equipment or protection system changes create new hazards
rules.applies_to: employees facing new equipment or protection system hazards

conditions.condition: changes in scaffolds, fall protection, or equipment create new hazards

rules.text: Retraining is required where inadequacies in an affected employee's work involving scaffolds indicate that the employee has not retained the requisite proficiency.
rules.requirement: provide retraining when work performance indicates loss of proficiency

appendices.title: Scaffold Specifications (Non-mandatory)
appendices.purpose: Guidelines to assist employers in complying with scaffold requirements

key_rules.text: All load-carrying timber members (except planks) shall be a minimum of 1,500 lb-f/in² (stress grade) construction grade lumber.
key_rules.requirement: use minimum 1,500 lb-f/in² stress grade lumber for load-carrying members

items.description: planks excluded from this requirement

key_rules.text: Maximum permissible span for light duty (25 lb/ft²): 10 feet for full thickness undressed lumber, 8 feet for nominal thickness lumber.
key_rules.requirement: limit light duty platform spans to specified maximums based on lumber type

key_rules.text: Maximum permissible span for medium duty (50 lb/ft²): 8 feet for full thickness undressed lumber, 6 feet for nominal thickness lumber.
key_rules.requirement: limit medium duty platform spans to specified maximums based on lumber type

key_rules.text: Maximum permissible span for heavy duty (75 lb/ft²): 6 feet.
key_rules.requirement: limit heavy duty platform spans to 6 feet maximum

key_rules.text: The maximum permissible span for 1¼ × 9-inch or wider wood plank of full thickness with a maximum intended load of 50 lb/ft² shall be 4 feet.
key_rules.requirement: limit 1.25x9 inch wood plank span to 4 feet for 50 lb/ft² load

key_rules.text: Distance between guardrail posts shall not exceed 8 feet.
key_rules.requirement: space guardrail posts maximum 8 feet apart

key_rules.text: Single pole wood pole scaffolds have specific requirements for different duty levels and heights, including maximum pole spacing, bearer requirements, and bracing specifications.
key_rules.requirement: follow specified requirements for single pole scaffold construction based on duty level and height

triggers.expression: light_duty_20ft OR light_duty_60ft OR medium_duty_60ft OR heavy_duty_60ft

key_rules.text: Independent wood pole scaffolds have specific requirements for different duty levels and heights, including maximum pole spacing and bearer requirements.
key_rules.requirement: follow specified requirements for independent pole scaffold construction based on duty level and height

triggers.expression: independent_light_duty_20ft OR independent_light_duty_60ft OR independent_medium_duty_60ft OR independent_heavy_duty_60ft

key_rules.text: Tube and coupler scaffolds require nominal 2 inch OD steel tube or pipe for posts, runners and braces, with specific bearer requirements based on duty level.
key_rules.requirement: use proper tube sizes and bearer specifications for tube and coupler scaffolds

key_rules.text: Maximum number of planked levels for fabricated frame scaffolds varies by duty: Light duty up to 16 levels (1 working level), 11 levels (2 working), 6 levels (3 working), 1 level (4 working). Medium duty: 11 levels (1 working), 1 level (2 working), 0 levels (3+ working). Heavy duty: 6 levels (1 working), 0 levels (2+ working). Maximum height 125 feet.
key_rules.requirement: limit fabricated frame scaffold levels based on duty and working levels

triggers.expression: (light_duty_1_working OR light_duty_2_working OR light_duty_3_working OR light_duty_4_working OR medium_duty_1_working OR medium_duty_2_working OR heavy_duty_1_working) AND max_height_125ft

key_rules.text: Bricklayers' square scaffolds: Maximum intended load 50 lb/ft², maximum width 5 feet, maximum height 5 feet.
key_rules.requirement: limit bricklayers' square scaffolds to specified load, width, and height

key_rules.text: Horse scaffolds: Light duty maximum intended load 25 lb/ft², medium duty 50 lb/ft². Light duty uses 2×4 inch horizontal members, medium duty uses 3×4 inch.
key_rules.requirement: construct horse scaffolds with proper load limits and member sizes

key_rules.text: Form and carpenters' bracket scaffolds: Maximum intended load 25 lb/ft². Bolts not less than 5/8 inches diameter. Maximum bracket spacing 8 feet on centers. No more than two employees per 8 feet, tools and materials not to exceed 75 pounds.
key_rules.requirement: construct bracket scaffolds with specified load limits, bolt sizes, spacing, and occupancy

triggers.expression: bracket_load AND bracket_bolt_diameter AND bracket_spacing AND bracket_occupancy AND bracket_materials

key_rules.text: Pump jack scaffolds: Wood poles shall not exceed 30 feet in height. Maximum intended load 500 lbs between poles applied at center of span. Not more than two employees between any two supports.
key_rules.requirement: limit pump jack scaffolds to 30 feet height, 500 lb load, and 2 employees between supports

key_rules.text: Ladder jack scaffolds: Maximum intended load 25 lb/ft². Not more than two employees on any platform at any one time. Maximum span between supports 8 feet.
key_rules.requirement: limit ladder jack scaffolds to 25 lb/ft² load, 2 employees, and 8 feet span

definitions.competent_person: One who is capable of identifying existing and predictable hazards in the surroundings or working conditions which are unsanitary, hazardous, or dangerous to employees, and who has authorization to take prompt corrective measures to eliminate them.
definitions.qualified: One who, by possession of a recognized degree, certificate, or professional standing, or who by extensive knowledge, training, and experience, has successfully demonstrated his/her ability to solve or resolve problems relating to the subject matter, the work, or the project.
